SHORT_DESCR.P: HIE is seeking a suitably qualified and experienced supplier to provide support to creative industries businesses in a variety of digital-related topics. Rather than focus directly on producing new content, XpoNorth Digital will focus on innovation around the relationship between producer and consumer. This will give businesses the tools and capability to carry out faster and more effective R and D for themselves, by engaging more effectively with customers and therefore tailoring products and services more closely to their needs. By combining specialised support focusing on innovating in the space where producers and consumers interact and adopting digital solutions, businesses can increase their profitability, increase their profile, make more effective use of technology and develop exciting new business models.
Should HIE’s application be successful for the Northern Periphery and Arctic Programme — Digital Story Tagging project, additional services will be required too.

Note, the services do not have to be delivered by a single supplier — HIE welcomes consortium bids and/or bids with subcontractors. However, the supplier / proposed group of suppliers must be able to carry out all of the services described in the Scope of Requirements. The following key tasks are to be delivered by the successful supplier (see Scope of Requirements for full details):
The contract is anticipated to be awarded for 3 years with HIE having the option to extend for a period or periods together not exceeding 1 calendar year following the Initial Term.
The NPA element (should it go ahead) will run from September 2018 to August 2021.

The story tagging software itself would be developed through the overall NPA digital story tagging project and not by the supplier of the XpoNorth Digital contract. The supplier would be able to take advantage of the learning and developments across the project to benefit the XpoNorth Digital project client base. However, the supplier would have responsibility for the delivery of a discrete element of the NPA project. This would focus on marketing, ongoing communication through a website and other channels keeping partners and other interested partners abreast of activity within the project. See Scope of Requirements for full details.

It is estimated that total value of these services over the maximum duration of 4 years will be between 810 000 GBP and 1 080 300 GBP excluding VAT. This is the figure which has been used in II.2.6. This figure includes the potential NPA element.
The breakdown of this budget is:
Max 918 300 GBP for the XpoNorth Digital core tasks including potential extension period.
Max 162 000 GBP for the NPA Story tagging element.
This Contract has not been divided into lots since this would make the execution of the contract excessively difficult.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The contract will be awarded for an initial period of 3 years with HIE having the option to extend for a period or periods together not exceeding 1 calendar years following the Initial Term. The NPA story tagging element of the contract would run from September 2018 to August 2021.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: HIE reserves the right, on giving reasonable written notice from time to time, to require changes to the Services (whether by way of the removal of Services, the addition of new Services, or increasing or decreasing the Services). HIE shall not require any such change other than where it is permitted by Regulation 72 of the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015.
The contract might be modified in the future — some examples, including but not limited to:
— Changes to sector require the services to be revised,
— Changes to the role of HIE in supporting the creative industries,
— Learning from the project necessitates amendments of the delivery model for certain tasks,
— If the NPA funded project is approved in June 2018, the supplier will be required to carry out the relevant tasks outlined in this document.

OBJECT_DESCR.EU_PROGR_RELATED: if the NPA story tagging element is required: ERDF

INFO_ADD.P: Economic operators may be excluded from this competition if they are in any of the situations referred to in Regulation 58 of the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015.

SUITABILITY.P: Not applicable to this procurement exercise.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: 4B.1.2 Bidders will be required to have an average yearly turnover of a minimum of 120 000 GBP for the last 2 years.
4B.5 It is a requirement of this contract that bidders hold, or can commit to obtain prior to the commence of any subsequently awarded contract, the types and levels of insurance indicated below:
Employer’s (Compulsory) Liability Insurance = 5 000 000 GBP for each and every claim.
Public Liability Insurance = 1 000 000 GBP for each and every claim.
Professional Indemnity Insurance = 1 000 000 GBP for any one claim and in the aggregate.
4B.6 As an alternative for Bidders who started trading less than 3 years prior to the ESPD return date, they must demonstrate adequate financial capacity by the following evidence:
(i) a business plan for a minimum 3 year trading period setting out projected annual average turnover of no less than the threshold stated above;
(ii) a statement of whether or not any full audited accounts are available for any years’ trading to date and copies of those accounts; and
(iii) a letter of support from their bank setting out the level of financial support available to them from their bank and for how long it is available.
Not applicable to this procurement exercise.

HIE as a public body must comply with HMRC IR35 provisions. Therefore, where you are bidding as a personal service company (PSC) or will be using a personal service company to provide services under the framework please identify these PSC (s) in your response to 4B.6.

Note re Q4B.1.2: If the Lead Bidder alone does not have the minimum 120 000 GBP average annual turnover in the last 2 years or the Lead Bidder is a newly established organisation with a projected average annual turnover of less than 120 000 GBP for a minimum of 3-year period, the Lead Bidder can rely on (an)other entity/entities to meet the minimum annual average turnover requirement (this could be a parent company and/or group of economic operators ie. subcontractors / consortium member / joint venture etc). The combined annual average turnover of the Lead Bidder and that of the entity / entities relied upon must meet the minimum annual average turnover of 120 000 GBP in the last 2 years.

If combining turnovers, the Lead Bidder should answer “Yes” to Q2C.1 of the ESPD and submit a separate ESPD for EACH of the entities relied upon (Part II sections A and B, Part III, the relevant section of Part IV and the Concluding Statements must be completed — see section “2C.1 Instructions for Bidders” in the ESPD).

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Bidders will be required to confirm whether they intend to subcontract and, if so, for what proportion of the contract.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: Targets and service levels are included in the Scope of requirements.

ESTIMATED_TIMING.P: HIE reserves the right to re-tender for these services upon termination of the contract or at the end of the contract period, including any extension period.

INFO_ADD.P: ESPD:
— Q 2A.3 (not scored) Where relevant, bidders are required to insert details of their Companies House (or equivalent) registration number,

— Where relevant, bidders are required to provide information relating to consortia (Q2C1 of ESPD) and/or subcontractors (Qs 2C1 and — 2D.1 of the ESPD) with the relevant supporting ESPD documentation being submitted,
— Q 3D.12 Bidders should refer to the “Conflict of Interest” Section within the Scope of Requirements when completing this question,

— Q4B.6 HIE as a public body must comply with HMRC IR35 provisions. Therefore, where you are bidding as a personal service company (PSC) or will be using a personal service company to provide services under the framework please identify these PSC(s) in your response to 4B.6.

Award Criteria Questions 1-3 will be scored on a Pass / Fail basis. A Pass will require a minimum score of “2.0”, as the result of the evaluation carried out by an independent cyber security consultant. Bidders which are unable to meet this minimum requirement for EACH of these questions will not be assessed further.
Award criteria scoring:
The Award criteria will be marked according to the following criteria:
0: Unacceptable — Nil or inadequate response which fails to demonstrate an ability to meet the requirement.

1: Poor — Response is partially relevant but generally poor. It addresses some elements of the requirement but contains insufficient / limited detail or explanation to demonstrate how the requirement will be fulfilled.
2: Acceptable — Response is relevant and acceptable. It addresses a broad understanding of the requirement but may lack details on how the requirement will be fulfilled in certain areas.
3: Good — Response is relevant and good. It is sufficiently detailed to demonstrate a good understanding and provides details on how the requirements will be fulfilled.

4: Excellent — Response is completely relevant and excellent overall. It is comprehensive, unambiguous and demonstrate a thorough understanding of the requirement and provides details of how the requirement will be met in full.

Bidders should note that any bid which exceeds the maximum stated budget will be regarded as unacceptable to HIE and consequently be considered as non-compliant. See breakdown of budget (XpoNorth Digital core project and NPA story tagging) in the Scope of Requirements and Tender Guidance Notes Document.

In order to participate, bidders should register, for free, on the Public Contracts Scotland (PCS) website (www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk), and record their interest in this contract and download and complete all relevant documentation.

Tenders must be submitted via the PCS postbox and must be received by the published deadline. Late tenders will not be accepted and HIE will reject any submissions received after the deadline. Email or hard copy responses will not be accepted.
PCS also gives suppliers access to an on-line Question and Answer facility which allows queries to be submitted (anonymously), and answers published and shared with all potential bidders.

Note: To register your interest in this notice and obtain any additional information please visit the Public Contracts Scotland website at http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/Search/Search_Switch.aspx?ID=529258

The buyer has indicated that it will accept electronic responses to this notice via the Postbox facility. A user guide is available at http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/sitehelp/help_guides.aspx
Suppliers are advised to allow adequate time for uploading documents and to dispatch the electronic response well in advance of the closing time to avoid any last minute problems.
Download the ESPD document here: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/ESPD/ESPD_Download.aspx?id=529258
